text: "What a Diff'rence a Day Made" as recorded "What a Diff'rence a Day Makes" is a popular song written in Spanish in 1934 with the title "Cuando vuelva a tu lado" ("When I Return to Your Side"). In 1959 it was recorded in English as What a Diff'rence a Day Makes by Dinah Washington and won a Grammy Award in 1959. It was a hit again in 1975 with Esther Phillips using a bit of disco thrown into it. ==References== Category:1934 songs Category:Ben E. King songs Category:Dean Martin songs Category:Esther Phillips songs Category:Bobby Darin songs Category:Randy Crawford songs Category:Rod Stewart songs Category:Barry Manilow songs Category:The Temptations songs Category:The Black Sorrows songs Category:Aretha Franklin songs Category:Cher songs Category:Diana Ross songs Category:Gloria Estefan songs
title: What a Diff'rence a Day Makes
